Like I said, the symptoms didn‚Äôt hit me all at once. Cough and aches came first, with a 99.5 fever and the loss of smell. Cough got a bit better, aches went away. I thought I was on the mend. Not totally 100%, but getting better. This is around March 25-26.

It started with tightness, then a cough. The cough was deeper than any I‚Äôve ever had. I am not kidding when I say it lasted 17 full days. The mucus I coughed up was dark and occasionally had blood in it. Early on, I did get a headache that caused sensitivity behind my eyes.

This virus was no joke. It lasted a LONG time and took a few different shapes. There‚Äôs a reason everyone is confused about COVID: it presents differently in everyone. I never had a 103 fever, my max was 100. My cough was junky, not dry. But a host of other symptoms matched up.

Took me 13 days to qualify for a test even though I had:

- chills
- aches
- cough (mucus + blood)
- chest pain
- low-grade fever (99.5)
- *total* loss of sense of smell

My fever wasn‚Äôt high enough to qualify til it hit 100 yesterday. Lack of testing here is out of control. 2/3

At the same time, I completely lost my sense of smell for about two weeks. And I mean completely. Aftershave on my face, cookies out of the oven, candle under my nose‚Äînot a whiff. My smell has returned to a small degree. Now it improves every day.
